intro: Eriocephalus brevifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eriocephalus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
